What is the purpose of setting `proofprotocol` to 1 in the `definecurrency` command?

There is no purpose to setting `proofprotocol` to 1 in the `definecurrency` command, as it is not a valid or recommended setting. In fact, `proofprotocol` is typically set to 2, which is PROOF_CHAINID, allowing the controller of the chain ID to mint new coins.

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":33, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["vrsctest", "gold"],"minpreconversion":[10000,5.1298]}, "initialsupply":20000'
```
In "mycoin", I set proofprotocol to 2, which is PROOF_CHAINID. That means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins as follows:```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```
Can anyone mint new coins in the "mycoin" currency?
No, only the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins in the "mycoin" currency, as specified by the `proofprotocol` being set to 2 (PROOF_CHAINID).

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":33, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["vrsctest", "gold"],"minpreconversion":[10000,5.1298]}, "initialsupply":20000'
```
In "mycoin", I set proofprotocol to 2, which is PROOF_CHAINID. That means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins as follows:```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```
What is the command to destroy existing coins in the "mycoin" currency?
There is no command to destroy existing coins in the "mycoin" currency. The available commands only allow defining a new currency and minting new coins in that currency.

```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST definecurrency '{"name":"mycoin","options":33, "proofprotocol":2,"currencies":["vrsctest", "gold"],"minpreconversion":[10000,5.1298]}, "initialsupply":20000'
```
In "mycoin", I set proofprotocol to 2, which is PROOF_CHAINID. That means that the controller of the chain ID can mint new coins as follows:```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "mycoin@" '[{"address":"mike@","currency":"mycoin","mintnew":1,"amount":10000}]'
```
